Text:
As requested, I've gathered intel on Sergey from the
MNA archives.
Thank you, Beta. What would you like to drink?

We've actually just received some coffee beans for
distribution testing—

Umm... I'll skip the coffee for now. Do you have any
apple juice?
Of course! I'll have someone bring it right away.

...The records detailing Velgalta's Seven Blades
were more extensive than anticipated.

Events such as the "Bushin Festival" and the
"Goddess' Trial" involving individuals competing in
combat attract many participants, resulting in
numerous detailed interviews.

It appears to be an interest shared by many.
So, what about Sergey?

Right. Initially a regular knight within the Velgalta
Empire, he rose through the ranks after defeating the
senior knight Stan Bach, one of Velgalta's Seven
Blades, during the annual imperial tournament.

Stan Bach was killed during this fight, yet according
to the imperial tournament regulations, his passing
was classified as an accident within the duel.

A culture where even the audience embraces the death
of contestants... Very emblematic of Velgalta,
isn't it?

...So far, this all corresponds with what we already
know.

And from here, our intel consists of fragments pieced
together from various sources.

Sergey Gorman. Born in Volzano in the western region
of the Oriana Kingdom.

Sergey's parents immigrated from Velgalta to
establish a vineyard for white wine production—

However, Sergey discovered greater potential for
wealth in his swordsmanship than in the wine
business. He returned to Velgalta, where he could
rely on his skills to become a knight.
...But there are peculiarities about this story.

Peculiarities? You mean his background is
fabricated?

Something along those lines. There are no official
records of the individuals said to be Sergey's
parents.

Nor any records of the grape business, let alone any
previous life in the Oriana Kingdom.
...So you're saying that none of it exists?

When Sergey first assumed the title of "Velgalta's
Seven Blades," it seemed there were initially
some concerns...

However, due to Velgalta's culture, which places high
value on individual strength, Sergey's position faced
no significant threat.

...According to No. 111, Stan Bach was a First
Child of the Cult and a highly skilled swordman.

Sergey challenged this First Child to a duel in a
highly publicized setting with no means of escape:
the imperial tournament... And he emerged victorious.

While it's customary for Velgalta's Seven Blades to
engage contenders through the imperial tournament...

It seems the Cult of Diablos didn't anticipate one
of their own Children being defeated in such a
significant match by an outsider knight with no
affiliation to the Cult.

While publicly, Sergey's ascension to the "Velgalta's
Seven Blades" title might have appeared ordinary,
within the Cult, the notion of a Child being defeated
must have come as a surprise!

The Cult of Diablos making Sergey a Child likely
signifies that they deemed him worthy of the title
due to his willingness to align with their cause.
Viewed that way...

It wouldn't be implausible for all of his inconvenient
past to be wiped clean once he became a Child.

Especially considering the Cult of Diablos' capacity
to easily manipulate information in such a way.

A Child of the Cult with formidable combat
skills and solid organizational backing...

Sergey is the most dangerous adversary the Garden
has encountered since its inception. But what is the
source of his strength and regenerative abilities?

And how can we breach the armor guarding his heart
and penetrate the core of the organization known as
the Rounds?

It's essential to start by unveiling our adversary's
true identity.
To do that, our first step will be making our way...
...to Velgalta!
